remarks: The Orbit-Stabilizer theorem.  The mapping ` F ` is a bijection from the cosets of the stabilizer subgroup of ` A ` to the orbit of ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jan-2015.)
statement:
gasta.1 $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
gasta.2 $e |- H = { u e. X | ( u .(+) A ) = A } $.
orbsta.r $e |- .~ = ( G ~QG H ) $.
orbsta.f $e |- F = ran ( k e. X |-> <. [ k ] .~ , ( k .(+) A ) >. ) $.
orbsta.o $e |- O = { <. x , y >. | ( { x , y } C_ Y /\ E. g e. X ( g .(+) x ) = y ) } $.
orbsta $p |- ( ( .(+) e. ( G GrpAct Y ) /\ A e. Y ) -> F : ( X /. .~ ) -1-1-onto-> [ A ] O ) $.
$d .(+) g k u x y $.
$d .~ g k x y $.
$d A g k u x y $.
$d G g k u x y $.
$d H x y $.
$d O k $.
$d X g k u x y $.
$d Y g k x y $.
